images.copyright: Coral reef in the Indian Ocean, Mayotte, France (© Gabriel Barathieu/Minden Pictures)
images.title: Deep and meaningful
images.caption: Coral Reef Awareness Week
images.desc: Blooming pillar corals, green sea turtles, and colorful reef fishes—welcome to the underwater universe of coral reefs. They are formed by tiny marine organisms called coral polyps, which create vast colonies housing many species. As we celebrate their beauty and benefits, it's vital to recognize the lurking threats of climate change, pollution, and harmful human activities.
